title: Report: Bullet fired into Reid's office in May '24
content: A bullet penetrated the glass in the practice facility office of Andy Reid while the Chiefs coach was working alone in it last year, The Kansas City Star reported Wednesday night.

title: Bueckers lights up L.A. for WNBA rookie-record 44
content: Dallas guard Paige Bueckers scored a WNBA rookie-record 44 points Wednesday night, but the Wings came up short in a buzzer-beating loss to the Sparks.

title: Yankees tie MLB mark with 14 HRs over 2 games
content: New York finished with five home runs Wednesday night and 14 in the series sweep of the Rays, tying a major league record (Reds, 1999) for most homers in a two-game series.

title: Cowboys coach expects to have Parsons in opener
content: Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer is confident Pro Bowl edge rusher Micah Parsons will be available for the Sept. 4 season opener against the Eagles.

title: Ohtani rocked, struck by liner in 'regrettable' start
content: Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani gave up five earned runs and nine hits in four innings, and got hit on his thigh by a 93 mph line drive in an 8-3 loss to the Rockies.

title: Saints acquire WR Vele, send picks to Broncos
content: The Saints added to their receiver room ahead of the regular-season opener Wednesday, acquiring Devaughn Vele in a trade with the Broncos, who received two future draft picks in return.

title: 49ers WR Robinson faces 3-game suspension
content: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Wednesday on San Francisco's KNBR radio that wide receiver Demarcus Robinson has been suspended three games stemming from a misdemeanor DUI charge.

title: Sources: Jets land Phillips in 2nd DT trade of day
content: The Jets acquired Harrison Phillips from Minnesota, sources told ESPN, their second trade of the day for a defensive tackle after they added Jowon Briggs from the Browns.

title: 👕 A history of soccer's most iconic jerseys
content: How did soccer's most storied clubs become synonymous with something as simple as a color? ESPN relives the kit histories of football's biggest teams.

title: 32 pick projections, eight months out: Yates’ early NFL mock draft of Round 1 has some surprises
content: Could Arch Manning go No. 1? Will QBs dominate the first round? Which teams could land playmakers? Field Yates projects next year's opening 32 picks.

title: Projecting next year's QB market: Most likely scenarios and long shot possibilities for 12 NFL teams
content: We picked teams with some level of QB1 uncertainty for 2026 and projected two potential outcomes for each: one likely, one not so likely.

title: New York finally solved Minnesota -- what does it mean for the WNBA playoffs?
content: Minnesota and New York met four times in 20 days. Here are five things we learned in their WNBA Finals rematches.

title: Don't sleep on them: The 43 players who could break out in 2025
content: We ranked the top 100 college football players, but which other players might do big things this season?

title: Can DJ Lagway become Florida's next great quarterback?
content: In his sophomore season, the signal-caller will try to lead Florida to its first College Football Playoff appearance.

title: Burrow, McConkey among Matt Bowen's top 10 draft targets, Warren among late fliers
content: Matt Bowen ranks the most common players he has been drafting this summer and includes a handful of late-rounders to put on the radar.

title: Tour Championship rankings: From Scottie Scheffler all the way to No. 30
content: Who comes in at No. 2 behind Scheffler? Where do U.S. Ryder Cup hopefuls rank? We break down the entire Tour Championship field.

title: To keep up with their rivals, Man United must master the art of offloading players
content: Man United have struggled to maximize value from outgoing transfers. Can they flip the script with Alejandro Garnacho and others before the window closes Sept. 1?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Rogers, Eze after Havertz injury
content: Arsenal are closing on Crystal Palace midfielder Eberechi Eze but are also tracking Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: The little-known FIFA rule that gives Isak all the leverage over Newcastle
content: Breaking down a little-known FIFA rule called Article 17. It could be the key to unlocking Isak's future.

title: NBA milestones: Landmarks to watch this season for LeBron, Jokic and others
content: Important milestones to watch ahead of the 2025-26 season, including another historic season from LeBron James and Nikola Jokic.

title: Are the Colts, Anthony Richardson headed for a breakup? Is there a trade market? What's next?
content: Naming Daniel Jones the starter might have irrevocably damaged the relationship between the Colts and Richardson? Here's what to know.

title: AFC North preview: Ravens favored, but Bengals lurk
content: Can the Bengals overcome the Ravens in the North? Here are all the odds for each team in the division and our favorite bets.

title: Preseason predictions revisited: What we got right, wrong about 2025
content: The summer break is the opportune time to look back on ESPN's predictions and expectations for the 2025 F1 season.

title: Ilona Maher is rugby's biggest star. Can she transform the Women's Rugby World Cup?
content: Ilona Maher became a household name at the 2024 Paris Olympics and is now one of the most visible athletes in global sport. Now comes her next big act at Women's Rugby World Cup.

title: Red Sox icon Jason Varitek decides fantasy football draft order with batting practice
content: The Red Sox called on the 2005 Silver Slugger (and current Boston coach) to be the deciding factor of their fantasy draft order.

title: Jalen Brunson, Natalia Bryant star together in new Nike Kobe sneaker ad
content: A key feature of the new Nike Kobe 3 Protro is diamond shapes on the upper and outsole in honor of Natalia.

title: Pickups: Top prospects and save chances to add
content: The players you should be claiming off the waiver wire, including some top prospects making their MLB debuts.

title: 34 habitations affected by Godavari flood on Andhra-Telangana borders
content: 16 boats have been deployed to evacuate 950 families along the banks of rivers of Sabari and Godavari

title: Four Calcutta University students assaulted after being called ‘Bangladeshi’ in heated exchange near Sealdah station
content: Tensions escalated when other students learnt about the assault and staged a protest outside the Muchipara Police Station

title: Telangana Assembly Speaker in focus as he faces SC’s deadline to decide status of turncoat MLAs
content: MLAs switching loaylties was seen in erstwhile United Andhra Pradesh, BRS’s two terms in Telangana and now in Congress

title: Udupi police take Mahesh Shetty Thimarody into custody for comments on BJP national general secretary B.L. Santosh
content: Mr. Thimarody left his house in his vehicle, accompanied by fellow activist Girish Mattannavar, a former sub-inspector of police, and a few of his supporters towards Brahmavar

title: Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkoottathil quits as State Youth Congress president amid misconduct allegations
content: Rahul Mamkoottathil says he is stepping down ‘not because of any wrongdoing, but to protect Congress party’ as it intensifies its fight against LDF government in Kerala

title: Vadakalai and Tenkalai issues are ‘ticklish, sensitive, and never-ending,’ says Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh dismisses plea to emboss Vadakalai Namam on the silver Kavacham affixed on the Kulasekarapadi of Devarajaswamy Temple in Kancheepuram

title: 130th Constitutional Amendment Bill a move to “weaken democracy”: BSP chief Mayawati
content: "The public fears that ruling parties will mostly misuse it for their own gain, selfishness, and animosity. It would be appropriate for the government to reconsider it in the interest of the country's democracy and the Constitution," Mayawati said in a post

title: Goa: Ramesh Tawadkar, Digambar Kamat sworn in as Ministers in Pramod Sawant Cabinet
content: Hours before the swearing-in, Ramesh Tawadkar resigned as the Speaker of the Goa Legislative Assembly

title: Supreme Court refuses urgent hearing of plea challenging MCD notification on picking of stray dogs
content: The application submitted that MCD issued the notification despite orders having been reserved by the apex court.

title: Kerala Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan vows strict action against ‘Congress person’ accused of misconduct toward aspiring actor
content: Satheesan declines to name the accused and ignores calls from journalists who mentioned the alleged wrongdoer’s name multiple times in front of television cameras

title: Haryana Human Rights Commission seeks report in an alleged bonded labour case, highlights failures in protective mechanisms
content: The victim, 14, was walking along the road in Nuh with an injured hand, when he was spotted two schoolteachers and taken to the police station

title: Centre invites Manipur Naga bodies for talks on FMR, Myanmar border fencing
content: The discussion scheduled for August 26 follows a meeting between a United Naga Council team with the State’s Governor

title: TVK State conference in Madurai LIVE: Thousands flock to listen to Vijay
content: Mr. Vijay is scheduled to address the cadres during the conference that is scheduled to begin around 4 p.m.

title: No need to give political angle to Raj Thackeray-Devendra Fadnavis meeting: Ajit Pawar
content: Talking to reporters in Wardha, Mr. Pawar said, “Many leaders meet one another as well as with the Chief Minister, irrespective of whether they are in power or not. Maintaining communication with each other is the tradition of the State

title: Man held over GST credit fraud worth ₹47.32 crore
content: Investigation revealed that a firm run by Vivek Rajesh Maurya, had fraudulently claimed and passed on ITC without any actual supply of goods or services

title: Haryana teacher cremated; mobile internet suspension extended by a day in Bhiwani
content: The teacher’s body was found in a field in Bhiwani on August 13; she had gone missing on August 11 after leaving the school, purportedly to enquire about admission at a nursing college

title: Retired employees to join ‘Bengaluru Chalo’ protest on August 22 to demand equal benefits under 7th Pay Commission
content: Government excluded retirees from July 2022 to July 2024 from benefits of retirement allowance, pension and earned leave based on revised salaries

title: INDIA bloc V-P nominee B. Sudershan Reddy files nomination
content: “Since I don’t belong to any political party, I believe everyone would support me,” said the former judge

title: Sexual misconduct allegations against unnamed leader rock Kerala politics
content: The woman, who on Wednesday accused the politician of electronically stalking her and bombarding her with unsolicited, salacious WhatsApp messages, has yet to identify him

title: Bike taxis return to Bengaluru roads, taking cue from oral remarks of Karnataka High Court
content: On August 21 morning, The Hindu found that both Uber and Rapido had re-introduced the bike taxi booking feature while Ola has not yet resumed the service

title: Madras High Court recalls order in favour of Edappadi Palaniswami’s AIADMK leadership
content: Justice P.B. Balaji recalls the order since the filing of a caveat by the other party was not brought to his notice when the interim stay was granted

title: U.S. should treat India as 'prized free, democratic' partner: Nikki Haley
content: “Scuttling 25 years of momentum with the only country (India) that can serve as a counterweight to Chinese dominance in Asia would be a strategic disaster,” said the Republican leader

title: Trichy’s unique restaurant where no dish costs more than ₹30
content: Mohan Shanmugam runs Chellammal Manpaanai Samayal in Trichy, where traditional vegetarian meals are cooked in clay pots, and sustainability is not just a buzzword

title: Land acquisition: Forum in Karnataka pushes for inclusive model, farmer development approach rather than revenue generation for business
content: Among the key issues debated were attempts to weaken provisions for prior consent and fair compensation, the displacement caused by power plants, highways, airports, and industrial corridors

title: Dangerous explosives found outside Kerala school
content: Explosives were found on Wednesday evening when a student threw one of the devices, suspected to be used for eliminating wild boar, resulting in an explosion, causing minor injuries to both himself and an elderly woman, police said

title: Presidential Reference hearing LIVE: SC has set aside constitutional amendments in the past when it violated the Basic Structure: CJI
content: A five-judge Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court is hearing the Presidential Reference on 14 questions raised by President Murmu on the power to consider Bills in a stipulated time.

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 21 LIVE: Parliament adjourned sine die; Lok Sabha passed 12 bills, Rajya Sabha 14 amid Opposition protests
content: Barring discussions on Operation Sindoor in both House, the session has seen little business ever since it began on July 21

title: Balal panchayat in Kerala’s Kasaragod introduces breakfast scheme for schoolchildren
content: The panchayat has allocated ₹7.5 lakh from its annual Plan Fund for the initiative, aimed at encouraging children to continue their education

title: Heritage Foods was my first successful venture after three failures, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Crediting his wife and daughter-in-law for its success, he says the company has presence in 12 States with an annual turnover of ₹5,000 crore

title: NHL 26 Be A Pro Mode overhauls presentation and storyline
content: Players can take control of a single skater's career, from the minors to retirement, in Be A Pro Mode.

title: Amid protests over death of a school teacher in Haryana, CM announces to hand over the probe to CBI
content: “State government and the police administration are working with full seriousness and transparency” to ensure justice for “our daughter Manisha”

title: Delhi CM attack case: Accused sent to five-day police remand
content: Delhi police has registered a case under section 109(1) Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) (Attempt to murder, Imprisonment for 10 years, and fine)

title: Second Godavari flood warning issued in Andhra
content: The First Godavari Flood warning has been issued at Dowleswaram; relief operations begin in the Godavari Delta; officers on the field to prevent breaches to the embankments of Godavari river

title: At least 5 Delhi schools receive bomb threats, third such incident in four days
content: Police teams, along with fire personnel and bomb disposal squads, rushed to the school premises immediately.

title: Union Home Secretary takes stock of implementation of new criminal laws
content: He stresses the importance of strengthening the forensic ecosystem by filling the vacancies with eligible persons on contract basis

title: Naidu inaugurates Ratan Tata Innovation Hub and its five regional centres
content: Set up on a hub-and-spoke model, the aim is to nurture one entrepreneur in every family by extending them the required hand-holding with the support of corporate and knowledge partners, says the Chief Minister

title: Andhra Pradesh in the forefront in fostering gender equity, women empowerment, says Mahila Commission chief Sailaja
content: Representatives from government, industry, academia and civil society deliberate on strategies for promoting inclusive leadership, gender equity, and resilient workplaces at the CII-Indian Women Network conclave

title: The complex web of factors behind India’s persistent stunting crisis
content: A host of factors including teenage pregnancies, poor maternal and child nutrition, and lack of sanitation perpetuates stunting

title: Durg Nuns arrest: Tribal ‘victims’ approach women’s commision, seek action against Bajrang Dal members
content: The complaint alleged that they were involved in forcibly converting three young tribal women from Narayanpur and trafficking them, an allegation that the tribal women have denied all along

title: Mumbai rains LIVE updates: Seven primary lakes supplying water to Mumbai nearing full capacity, shows BMC data
content: All public transport services in Mumbai, including local trains, resumed normal operations on August 20 morning, a day after the torrential rains crippled normal life

title: Protest in Assam tribal council against move to transfer land to corporate houses
content: Tribal groups in Tinsukia call a shutdown on August 24 against the Cabinet decision to let non-tribals settle in the Tirap Tribal Belt

title: Shiromani Akali Dal, its breakaway faction engage in show of strength
content: Leaders from opposing stages made competing claims to persuade the public about who represents the “real” Akali Dal

title: Dignity and self-respect is more important than economic development: R. Adhiyaman, Aathi Thamizhar Peravai
content: Mr. Adhiyaman said the disagreement has laid bare difference between the Communist and the Periyarist point of views in the issue of conservancy workers’ protests and their demands.

title: Tripura Minister unveils bust of M.S. Swaminathan in Agartala
content: The late geneticist played a vital role in transforming the country from a food-deficient nation to one of self-sufficiency, Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Minister Ratan Lal Nath said

title: ‘Stree Shakti’ is a responsibility, not a burden, says Transport Minister Ramprasad
content: 750 new electric buses will be added to the APSRTC fleet soon, he says, adding that there is also a proposal to covert Palle Velugu buses into AC services in the next two years

title: One lakh individuals found ineligible so far under reverification of Sadaram disability certificates, says Minister Kolusu Parthasarathy
content: The drive is solely aimed at eliminating those fraudulently availing of pensions under NTR Bharosa scheme, he says; those wrongly declared ineligible can still appeal to the local authorities for reconsideration, he adds

title: CM Naidu sets target of building 10 lakh houses March 2026
content: Announcing that 3 lakh families will perform house-warming ceremony next month, the Chief Minister calls for a 15-day Statewide survey to identify homeless families and prepare a beneficiary list

title: Congress unions seek benefits for MGNREGS workers in Kerala
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan, who inaugurated the protest, demanded that the government increase the number of working days to a minimum of 200 per year

title: Bangladesh’s accusations are misplaced, says Centre
content: Awami League’s activities  in India “may trigger public sentiment”, says interim government of Bangladesh

title: Panel to discuss the potential for integrated townships in Coimbatore on August 22
content: As per the 2011, Census, the rate of urbanisation in Tamil Nadu was 48.45% and according to latest projections, the rate of urbanisation in Tamil Nadu has reached 63% in 2021

title: Russia welcomes Wang Yi’s visit and the positive turn in India-China ties
content: The senior Russian diplomat described the energy ties between India and Russia as having remained unaffected by tariffs and sanctions from the U.S. and the EU

title: A historic move, but still unequal
content: Internal reservation matrix cleared by the Karnataka cabinet is a step forward, but the most backward communities within SC population have not got what they had hoped for

title: Ranchi school students accuse teacher of sexual harassment
content: Ranchi Deputy Commissioner Manjunath Bhajantri orders probe into the incident; teacher is absconding after reports of the complaint went viral on social media

title: ED arrests banned Maoist outfit’s supremo Dinesh Gope in money laundering case
content: He ran an extensive extortion racket and later laundered the collected money through a complex network of shell companies and firms, says the agency

title: Congress, RJD preparing ground to justify their defeat in the upcoming Assembly election: Bihar Minister Sanjay Saraogi
content: Opposition is in panic because infiltrators’ names are being removed by Election Commission, says Sanjay Saraogi

title: Hyderabad gamers hail Online Gaming Bill as boost for esports, curb on addiction
content: Hyderabad’s esports and gaming community welcome the Bill for shifting the conversation away from gambling-like activities

title: India’s democracy is failing the migrant citizen
content: A migrant’s dual belonging, which is economic participation in a host State and political identity in his home State, is being demonised by the state

title: Not much Onam cheer for independent traditional weavers of Balaramapuram
content: Many of the elderly weavers working on contract in Thiruvananthapuram’s handloom hub chose weaving as their vocation at a very young age. For some, it was a glamorous job then. Some started at a daily wage of ₹3.5, and decades later, despite mounting inflation, the remuneration has touched only ₹250.

title: ‘Lady don’ Aruna sent to 14-day remand
content: She was arrested near Addanki and shifted to Kovur police station on Wednesday, following which she was produced in a court based on an extortion complaint filed by her house owner

title: LAC row: India to keep tight vigil; Several PLA arms brigades still remain forward deployed
content: "The way China has built roads, bridges, tunnels and habitats along the entire LAC, from eastern Ladakh to Arunachal, over the last five years, PLA troops can easily afford to pull back 100-150km and then come back again in 2-3 hours," a senior Army officer told TOI. ​Our forces cannot. This huge time differential in mobilisation between the rival forces will have to be factored in during any de-escalation talks,a senior Army officer said.

title: Kerala Youth Cong chief resigns: Model, writer allege harassment; 'invited me to hotel'
content: Rahul Mamkoottathil, Youth Congress state President, resigned amidst allegations made by women. At a press conference in Adoor, he claimed the accusations were a diversion from LDF government issues. Rahul asserted his innocence, stating no formal complaint was filed against him.

title: Ahmedabad student murder: ‘Kon hain, kya karlega tu?’ Accused’s shocking chat surfaces on social media
content: Viral WhatsApp chats allegedly reveal the accused admitting to stabbing Nayan Satani, a Class 10 student, during an altercation. The messages show the accused recounting the incident and identifying the victim. A friend advises him to delete the chats and flee, prompting a police investigation into the authenticity of these exchanges as crucial evidence in the ongoing case.

title: AI risks: Microsoft AI CEO warns of ‘AI Psychosis’; what it means, and why it matters
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman is warning about 'AI psychosis,' a condition where excessive AI interaction blurs the line between human and machine, potentially leading to detachment from reality and distorted perceptions.

title: 'No signal from Moscow to end war': Zelenskyy seeks US response if Putin avoids talks
content: President Zelensky has firmly stated Ukraine will not recognize Russia's territorial claims, demanding security guarantees within days before any talks. He seeks a strong US reaction if Russia avoids bilateral meetings, while outlining ambitious defense production plans. Amidst ongoing Russian attacks, Zelensky urges increased international pressure and support, emphasizing Moscow's disinterest in peace.

title: Big revelation! 'He was better than Sachin Tendulkar': Vinod Kambli's brother
content: Virendra Kambli, brother of Vinod Kambli, speaks about Vinod and Sachin Tendulkar. He says Vinod never felt superior to Sachin. Virendra emphasises their strong friendship. Sachin still supports Vinod. They shared camaraderie during Ranji Trophy matches. Virendra recalls fun times in the dressing room. Vinod's Test average was impressive. Sachin became a record-breaking legend. Their bond remains strong.

title: Namaskara Bengaluru: Apple get ready to open 3rd store in India; Date & time
content: Apple is set to inaugurate its first store in Bengaluru, Apple Hebbal, on September 2, marking its third retail venture in India. Following successful launches in Mumbai and Delhi, this new store at Phoenix Mall of Asia will showcase Apple's full product range, expert support, and educational sessions.

title: Attack on Delhi CM Rekha Gupta: Attacker aspired to open animal hospital, loved dogs
content: Rajkot police identified Rajesh Sakariya, an autorickshaw driver and ardent dog lover, as the man who assaulted the Delhi chief minister. Sakariya's mother stated he is mentally unstable and was upset about the Supreme Court's ruling on stray dogs in Delhi, believing the chief minister would enforce it.

title: GST revamp: GoM backs Centre’s two-slab plan; accepts scrapping 12% & 28% rates
content: A Group of Ministers (GoM) has accepted a proposal to streamline the GST rate structure, reducing it from four slabs to two. The existing 12% and 28% rates would be eliminated, leaving standard rates of 5% and 18%. This reform aims to simplify the indirect tax system, provide relief to various sectors, and create a more transparent and growth-oriented regime.

title: ‘Bengali speakers must be Bangladeshis’: CU students attacked with hockey sticks, knives
content: Calcutta University students residing at Carmichael Hostel were assaulted by Hindi-speaking hawkers near Sealdah Bridge after being taunted for speaking Bengali and labeled as Bangladeshis. The altercation escalated from a price negotiation dispute to a violent attack with rods, hockey sticks, and knives, resulting in serious injuries to four students.

title: OpenAI unveils massive data center plans: AI infra sales possible; revenue boost by ChatGPT-5
content: OpenAI is embarking on a significant expansion, planning trillion-dollar data centers to meet the growing AI computational demands. The company is considering offering AI infrastructure services to other businesses, inspired by the AWS model. With revenue growth driven by ChatGPT subscriptions, OpenAI explores innovative financing, including potential IPO, to support its ambitious infrastructure plans.

title: Asia Cup: 'Mera naseeb hai' - Shreyas Iyer's father reveals son's emotional response
content: Santosh Iyer expressed his disappointment and perceived unfairness regarding his son Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad. Despite Shreyas' consistent IPL performances, including leading KKR to a title and PBKS to a final, selectors have overlooked him. Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar also criticized the decision, suggesting it indicates Iyer is no longer considered for T20 cricket.

title: NIRF 2025 rankings: What’s new, what’s changing, and what students should know
content: The NIRF 2025 rankings bring key changes, including a new Sustainable Development Goals category and negative scoring for retracted research papers. With parameters spanning teaching, research, inclusivity, and perception, the framework now emphasizes ethics, sustainability, and academic quality. Students should view rankings as one tool among many, considering faculty, infrastructure, and support before choosing institutions.

title: Dhanashree Verma breaks silence: Says parents urged divorce from Chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal’s divorce after five years of marriage turned into a painful chapter for both. The controversy only deepened when Chahal appeared in court wearing a T-shirt that read “Be Your Own Sugar Daddy.” Now, in a heartfelt conversation, Dhanashree has revealed how the separation deeply affected not just her but also her family.

title: Trish Stratus: WWE legend shares heartbreaking message announcing mother's passing
content: Trish Stratus, the WWE star, is grieving her mother, Alice Stratigeas. Alice passed away last week after battling cancer. Stratus shared a heartfelt tribute on Instagram. She expressed her deep sorrow and love for her mother. Stratus mentioned her mother's constant support. Alice was present throughout her career and family life.

title: What is Israel's E1 project? Long-frozen plan that will 'erase Palestine from the table'. What's next
content: Israel has greenlit the E1 settlement project in the West Bank, a move criticized for potentially bisecting Palestinian territories and obstructing a future state. Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich hailed the decision, while critics warn it will create an 'apartheid-like' system. The project, involving over 3,400 housing units, has faced international opposition for decades.

title: Over 70 still missing: As flood water recedes in J&K's Chasoti, severed limbs spook locals; toll rises to 68
content: Flash floods in Chasoti have resulted in a devastating scene, with the recovery of numerous severed limbs alongside intact bodies. The confirmed death toll has reached 68, with 72 still missing, leaving little hope for survivors.

title: How Russia reshaped India’s oil map? Middle East steady; small players hit
content: Russia's dominance in India's oil imports has reshaped trading dynamics, impacting smaller suppliers while Iraq, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE maintain significant positions. Despite pressure to reduce Russian imports, India continues the supply, with Russia now being the top supplier. This shift has marginalized suppliers from America and Africa, creating potential for their resurgence amid ongoing geopolitical pressures.

title: 'BJP wants Nitish, Naidu removed': Tejashwi slams Bill to remove PM, CMs
content: Tejashwi Yadav criticised the central government's new bill. The bill allows the removal of ministers facing serious criminal charges. Yadav alleged it targets Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu. He recalled past instances of chief ministers being jailed and later acquitted. He described the bill as a blackmail tactic. The bill mandates removal after 30 days of detention for serious offences.

title: VP election: INDIA bloc candidate B Sudershan Reddy files nomination
content: Justice (Retd) B Sudershan Reddy, the INDIA bloc's vice presidential candidate, submitted his nomination in Parliament, accompanied by prominent leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sonia Gandhi, and Rahul Gandhi. Kharge emphasized that Reddy's nomination signifies the opposition's dedication to democratic values amidst concerns about stifled voices in Parliament.

title: Maha churn again? Raj meets CM Fadnavis; a day after drawing blank in 'BEST' polls
content: Raj Thackeray's meeting with Devendra Fadnavis sparks political buzz. This follows a defeat for Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS in the BEST credit society elections. The loss is seen as a setback before the upcoming BMC polls. Fadnavis commented on the rejection of the 'Thackeray brand'. Raj Thackeray had recently shared a stage with Uddhav, criticizing the BJP's language policy.

title: Online gaming bill: What does it mean for esports? 5 key points
content: Lok Sabha has passed the Online Gaming Bill, banning money-based games while promoting Esports and social gaming. The move addresses concerns about addiction and financial fraud, though some worry it will drive gaming underground. The bill recognises e-sports, categorises social games, and establishes a national authority to oversee online gaming, with strict penalties for violations.

title: 'Terrorists emerged out of several tunnels': Israel repels major Hamas assault - watch
content: Hamas gunmen launched a daring raid on an IDF encampment in southern Gaza, resulting in injuries to four Israeli soldiers. The attack involved at least 18 militants emerging from a tunnel, opening fire with machine guns and RPGs. Israeli forces responded with small arms and air support, eliminating approximately ten militants.

title: 'Blood all over': Shocking South Delhi triple murder; couple, son killed
content: In a gruesome incident in south Delhi's Satbari Khark village, Prem Singh, his wife Rajani, and their elder son Ritik were found murdered in their home. Police suspect the younger son, Siddharth, who is currently missing, is the prime suspect. Evidence suggests Siddharth, who was undergoing psychiatric treatment for obsessive-compulsive disorder and aggressive behavior, confessed to the crime before disappearing.

title: Delhi CM attacked: Rekha Gupta’s security under review; Z+ ASL cover likely
content: Following Wednesday's attack on CM Rekha Gupta, a security review is underway, potentially leading to Z+ ASL protection with an advanced security liaison team. An inquiry is investigating lapses, and stricter visitor verification protocols are expected. Gupta currently has 45 personnel, but additional measures like barricades may be implemented to enhance her safety.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink with UIDAI: Aadhar-based verification in India
content: Starlink, under Elon Musk, is partnering with UIDAI to streamline KYC for Indian users via Aadhaar-based verification. This collaboration enables quick, secure, and paperless onboarding, ensuring regulatory compliance and a user-friendly experience. The initiative highlights the scalability and reliability of India's digital infrastructure, demonstrating how Aadhaar supports innovative technology adoption while maintaining transparency and user control over personal data.

title: Nayara navigates EU sanctions: Dark-fleet tankers keep operations flowing
content: Facing EU sanctions, Nayara Energy is utilizing dark-fleet tankers and limiting crude import options to maintain operations, raising concerns for India's energy security. The government has authorized coastal tankers and approved sanctioned vessels to assist Nayara. The refiner, crucial to India's market, now relies on Russian oil and special mechanisms to circumvent sanctions, ensuring stable supply despite geopolitical challenges.

title: 'Europe takes lion's share': JD Vance says US won't carry 'burden' of Ukraine's security
content: US vice president J D Vance says Europe will handle most of Ukraine's security. Washington will only help if needed. Donald Trump rules out sending American troops to Ukraine. However, the US may provide air security. Trump wants a deal where Nato covers the cost of US weapons to Ukraine. European allies are planning a force for future peace.

title: Asia Cup: Ex-India selector on Indian star - 'He could never be consistent'
content: Shubman Gill's Asia Cup vice-captaincy has intensified debate over Sanju Samson's T20 future, despite his selection. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar highlighted Gill and Samson as opening options alongside Abhishek Sharma. Captain Suryakumar Yadav strongly backed Jitesh Sharma's inclusion, praising his post-T20WC performance.

title: ‘Unhappy meals’: McDonald’s withdraws One Piece campaign; Pokemon cards triggered frenzy
content: McDonald's Japan has cancelled its planned One Piece promotion after a Pokemon campaign resulted in chaos and food waste. The previous promotion, featuring limited-edition Pokemon trading cards, led to long queues, bulk orders from resellers, and widespread complaints from families. McDonald's apologised and promised to prevent a repeat, opting to provide toys from earlier promotions instead.

title: India to ease business visa process for China amid improving bilateral ties
content: India is poised to ease visa restrictions for Chinese business professionals after a five-year hiatus, signaling improved bilateral relations. This move will allow executives from major companies like Xiaomi and Byd to enter India more easily. The relaxation aims to support Chinese companies operating in India and foster partnerships with Indian enterprises, boosting trade and investment.

title: iPhone 17 now made in Bengaluru: Foxconn starts production at $2.8 billion plant
content: Bengaluru strengthens its position in Apple's global manufacturing plans. Foxconn has commenced iPhone 17 production at its new Bengaluru facility. This unit represents Foxconn's second-largest operation outside China. The facility was built with a substantial investment. Apple aims to increase its production in India. This move highlights Bengaluru's growing importance in the tech giant's manufacturing ecosystem.

title: Saath Nibhaana Saathiya fame Gia Manek ties knot with actor Varunn Jain
content: Gia Manek and Varunn Jain delighted fans by announcing their marriage on August 21, celebrating with an intimate ceremony among loved ones. Gia, known as Gopi Bahu, and Varunn, recognized from 'Diya Aur Baati Hum,' shared joyful photos in traditional attire. Their journey from reel family in 'Saath Nibhaana Saathiya' to real-life partners has garnered widespread congratulations.

title: 'Ek mazaak September 14 ko hoga' - Ex-Pakistan cricketer on IND vs PAK clash
content: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali predicts a surprising outcome in the India versus Pakistan Asia Cup clash on September 14, fueled by his discontent with the Pakistan Cricket Board's recent decisions.

title: Nasa and IBM unveil ‘Surya’: AI model to forecast solar storms
content: NASA, in collaboration with IBM, has unveiled 'Surya,' a groundbreaking AI model designed to revolutionize space weather forecasting. Trained on nine years of Solar Dynamics Observatory data, Surya accurately predicts solar flares and eruptions, crucial for safeguarding satellites, communication systems, and power grids. Early results show a 16% accuracy boost and two-hour advance visual forecasts.

title: 'No strays on streets': MCD workers assaulted, dog-catching van vandalised
content: A group in Rohini has been booked for allegedly assaulting MCD workers and vandalizing a dog-catching van after dog-bite incidents at a government school. The incident escalated when a group of dog lovers allegedly attacked the MCD team, released captured dogs, and damaged their vehicle.

title: 'Gambhir, Agarkar killing 2027 WC chances’: Shubman Gill not ready to lead
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts Shubman Gill will be a prolific run-scorer for India, possessing a "phenomenal horoscope." While Gill's leadership has shown promise, Lobo suggests his captaincy might not immediately translate to major ICC trophy wins.

title: IDF begins first phase of Gaza City takeover plan; all you need to know
content: Israel escalated its military operations in Gaza, advancing into Gaza City's outskirts while simultaneously approving new settlement construction in the West Bank. These actions, coupled with a stalled ceasefire proposal, have sparked international concern. The Israeli military aims to dismantle Hamas's capabilities, but the long-term implications of a full takeover remain uncertain amid Arab nations' reluctance to govern Gaza post-conflict.

title: Delhi schools face fresh bomb threat: Police, fire teams deployed; third scare in 4 days
content: Delhi schools faced renewed panic as five institutions, including BGS International Public School, received bomb threats, prompting immediate responses from police and fire departments. This follows a similar incident where over 60 schools received hoax threats, demanding cryptocurrency and claiming planted explosives.

title: Delhi CM attacked: Planned crime? Accused visited the city for first time
content: Investigators suspect a planned assault on CM Rekha Gupta, tracing the accused Rajesh Sakriya's movements from Rajkot to Delhi. Sakriya, who arrived in Delhi on August 19th, visited temples and inquired about the CM's residence. He spent a night at a Dharamshala before arriving at Gupta's residence.

title: Trade deficit rising due to oil buy, need to address it: EAM in Russia
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar, during his Moscow visit, proposed measures to balance the $58.9 billion trade deficit caused by increased Indian oil imports from Russia. These include addressing trade barriers, improving logistics, and finalizing the India-Eurasian Economic Union FTA. Both nations aim to boost connectivity and cooperation in transport, energy, and other sectors, targeting $100 billion in trade by 2030.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Why are prices dipping - check outlook
content: Gold and silver price prediction today:Gold prices are currently dipping, testing a key support level of ₹97,000, while MCX Silver faces selling pressure after breaking support. Experts suggest a possible short-term gold bounce from ₹97,000, but caution is advised. Silver's outlook is bearish, with a crucial support level at ₹1,09,000.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Curious case of Sanju Samson — the unsettled star of Indian cricket
content: Sanju Samson has scored most of his IPL runs at No. 3, second only to Suresh Raina in terms of overall runs at that position. His record at No. 3 is strong, with an average of 38 and a strike rate of 143 in the IPL. But fitting him in there would mean dropping Tilak Varma, which would also break the left-hand/right-hand balance India have carefully built in their middle order.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens in green; Sensex up over 150 points, crosses 82k
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 was near 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 150 points.

title: ‘Coolie’ Day 7 BO: Rajinikanth film hits Rs 222.5 cr in week 1
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' has demonstrated a strong box office performance, garnering an estimated Rs 222.5 crore net in India during its first week. Despite weekday dips, the film's impressive opening of Rs 65 crore and extended weekend collections propelled it past the Rs 200 crore milestone, surpassing 'War 2' and solidifying Rajinikanth's continued box office dominance.

title: Amazon Enables 50 Million MSMEs With Digital Procurement Before Festive Season
content: Over 50 million Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises in India, who have GST and Business PAN (B-PAN), can have digital procurement access through Amazon Business ahead of the upcoming festive season, the global e-commerce giant said on Thursday

title: "Stay Loyal To Trump": JD Vance Warns Elon Musk Against Forming New Party
content: US Vice President JD Vance has cautioned President Donald Trump's former "first buddy", Elon Musk, against forming a new political party, saying he will be able to wield greater influence by working within the Republican Party.

title: Goa Assembly Speaker Ramesh Tawadkar Resigns, Joins State Cabinet As Minister
content: BJP MLAs Ramesh Tawadkar and Digambar Kamat were sworn in as ministers in the Goa cabinet led by Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Live Updates: Online Gaming Bill Passed In Rajya Sabha
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw tabled 'The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025' in Rajya Sabha on the last day of the Monsoon Session

title: Online Gaming Bill Clears Parliament Amid Huge Protests By Opposition
content: A bill to ban the operation, facilitation and advertising of online games played with money was cleared by Parliament on Friday, amid intense protests by the Opposition.

title: The Inside Story On Bill To Sack Jailed Chief Ministers
content: The Lok Sabha erupted in protests yesterday when Union Home Minister Amit Shah introduced the Constitution (130th Amendment) Bill that states that the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers and ministers, if jailed for more than 30 days

title: Massive Protest In Ahmedabad Over School Murder, Over 500 Booked For Vandalism
content: The protests against the murder of a Class 10 student by a junior at a private school in Ahmedabad continued on Friday, with the student wing of the opposition Congress alleging negligence by authorities and demanding closure of the institute.

title: Parent-Killing Menendez Brothers May Get Free After Over 30 Years
content: Lyle and Erik Menendez will appear before California's parole board to seek freedom this week, more than 35 years after the shotgun murders of their parents in the family's luxury Beverly Hills home.

title: Raj Thackeray Meets Devendra Fadnavis, Clarifies It Was Over Civic Issues, Not Political
content: A day after Thackeray brand failed to show magic in the BEST Credit Society elections, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray met CM Devendra Fadnavis at his official Varsha bungalow on Thursday, creating a buzz in the state politics.

title: "It Was Entire Nation's Mission": Shubhanshu Shukla On Visiting Space Station
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first astronaut to visit the International Space Station as part of the Axiom-4 mission, described his journey as a mission for the entire nation.

title: When US Judge Frank Caprio Wished India On Independence Day
content: Frank Caprio, the retired municipal judge in Rhode Island, died at the age of 88 after a long battle with pancreatic cancer.

title: Calcutta University Students Beaten Up For Speaking Bengali, Called 'Bangladeshis'
content: A group of shopkeepers from West Bengal's Sealdah market allegedly thrashed some Calcutta University students and called them 'Bangladeshis' on Wednesday night.

title: "Stupidest Tactical Move": Top US Economist Jeffrey Sachs Slams Trump Tariffs On India
content: US economist Jeffrey Sachs has doubled down on his criticism of the Donald Trump administration's move to impose 50 per cent punitive tariffs on India, calling the American President the great unifier of the BRICS.

title: "Battle Of Ideology": INDIA bloc Veep Candidate B Sudershan Reddy Files Nomination
content: INDIA bloc's Vice-Presidential nominee B Sudershan Reddy filed his nomination on Thursday in the presence of Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress Parliamentary Party chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Lok Sabha Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi.

title: Sea Ice To Ocean Currents, Antarctica Is Undergoing Abrupt Changes
content: Melting sea ice allows oceans to warm more rapidly, which melts more sea ice. Once triggered, they can be difficult or even impossible to reverse on timescales meaningful to humans.

title: "This Is Not, Never Will Be A Kiss Cam": Chris Martin After Affair Scandal
content: For years, Coldplay's "Jumbotron Song" segment has had Chris Martin improvise lyrics on the audience as the camera panned on to them.

title: Ukraine Cruise Missile To Strike Russia Is 'Flamingo'. First Version Was Pink
content: When a Ukrainian-made drone attacked an ammunition depot in Russia last September, it showcased Kyiv's determination to strike deep behind enemy lines and the prowess of its defense industry.

title: Major Internet Outage Hits Pakistan, Disrupts Businesses And Daily Life
content: A nationwide internet outage in Pakistan continues to disrupt businesses, financial services and daily life. Industry officials termed the internet outage as one of the most severe breakdowns in recent years.

title: UP Man Wanted Wife To Look Like Nora Fatehi, Allegedly Made Her Abort
content: The woman, a resident of Ghaziabad in Uttar Pradesh, alleged that her husband is a womaniser and watches inappropriate videos of women on the internet.

title: Where Is Hurricane Erin Now? Category 2 Storm Threatens Flooding From Florida To New England
content: Hurricane Erin strengthened on Wednesday and tracked northward, remaining a Category 2 storm while running parallel to the US East Coast. Forecasters warned the sprawling system, extensive in size, may intensify into a major hurricane by Thursday

title: Football Manager 26 revealed with a new engine and Premier League license
content: football manager 26 has a release window of fall 2025 . the game was previously only possible by modding the game . it will also feature the new engine that was set to be introduced in FM25 before it was cancelled . this will see an overhaul to the game's visuals .

title: Jameis and the Big Apple (and Eli too): Winston relishes a day immersed in New York
content: jameis Winston, 31, was on a tour of the city with super bowl winners and Giants legends . he began belting out lines to the musical "Hamilton" with a massive smile across his face . "it's the Greatest City in the world!" Winston repeated multiple times .

title: Top 10 NBA players at 2025 EuroBasket: Where Jokic and Doncic stack up abroad
content: euroBasket 2025 will feature the french and Serbian squads that Team USA beat in the knockout rounds of the 2024 Olympics . heavyweights like Serbia, Germany, France, Greece and Slovenia will have multiple NBA names on their roster . the tournament runs Aug. 27 through Sept. 14 .

title: What do NFL scouts think of Arch Manning and what can Texas expect from him?

title: The Unforgotten: Two QBs and the game that tied them together forever
content: quarterback ONE IS JAY KUTNER . he is a senior, 17 years old, wears no. 5 . his team is playing a preseason scrimmage against a public school . the coach is dissatisfied -- execution or effort, it hardly matters .
